abstract_summ: The results demonstrated that scaffold biocompatibility was increased significantly by loading poly-P. SMC related gene and protein expression level in MSCs cultured on poly-P-loaded scaffold was also increased significantly compared to those cells cultured on empty scaffold.Effective therapeutic enhancement of human umbilical vein endothelial cell (HUVEC) and umbilical artery smooth muscle cell (SMC) proliferation and tube formation in vitro promoted rapid cell proliferation and increased the number of migrated cells by ∼1.7 times.Abstract To understand the behavior of cells in natural environment, 3D scaffolds are needed to provide biomimetic environment for routine cell growth in vitro.Biocompatibility of the fabricated scaffold increased significantly by incorporating curcumin in the scaffold fibers, where protein adsorption, cell attachment, and viability were increased in the nanofiber/curcumin group compared with the other groups.Furthermore, by seeding mouse embryonic fibroblasts (NIH/3T3) cells, it clearly manifested that such scaffolds are favorable to cell adhesion, migration and proliferation efficiently.
title_summ: Efficient smooth muscle cell differentiation of iPS cells on curcumin-incorporated chitosan/collagen/polyvinyl-alcohol nanofibersPoly-phosphate increases SMC differentiation of mesenchymal stem cells on PLGA–polyurethane nanofibrous scaffoldEvidence of (anti)metamorphic properties of modified graphitic surfaces obtained in real time at a single-molecule level.Small changes in PDMMLA structure influence the adsorption behavior of ECM proteins and syndecan-4 on PDMMLA derivative surfaces: Experimental validation by tensiometric surface force measurements.Generating Nanotopography on PCL Microfiber Surface for Better Cell-Scaffold InteractionsElectronic and magnetic properties of diiron in extended carbon networks Fe2C6 and Fe2C12 from first principlesBicontinuous cubic phases in biological and artificial self-assembled systemsRobust Atomistic Modeling of Materials, Organometallic, and Biochemical SystemsElectrofluidic control of bioactive molecule delivery into soft tissue models based on gelatin methacryloyl hydrogels using threads and surgical sutures.Gelatin hydrogel membrane containing carbonate hydroxyapatite for nerve regeneration scaffold.
title_abstract_phrases: Effective therapeutic enhancement of human umbilical vein endothelial cell (HUVEC) and umbilical artery smooth muscle cell (SMC) proliferation and tube formation in vitro promoted rapid cell proliferation and increased the number of migrated cells by ∼1.7 times.The results demonstrated that scaffold biocompatibility was increased significantly by loading poly-P. SMC related gene and protein expression level in MSCs cultured on poly-P-loaded scaffold was also increased significantly compared to those cells cultured on empty scaffold.Generating Nanotopography on PCL Microfiber Surface for Better Cell-Scaffold InteractionsAbstract To understand the behavior of cells in natural environment, 3D scaffolds are needed to provide biomimetic environment for routine cell growth in vitro.Biocompatibility of the fabricated scaffold increased significantly by incorporating curcumin in the scaffold fibers, where protein adsorption, cell attachment, and viability were increased in the nanofiber/curcumin group compared with the other groups.The scaffold supportive functions from smooth muscle cell differentiation were studied when human-induced pluripotent stem cells were cultured on the scaffolds under differentiation medium.
